meanings.sent1: The police will incarcerate the criminal for his actions.
meanings.sent2: It is necessary to incarcerate dangerous individuals to protect society.
meanings.sent3: I hope they don't incarcerate me for eating all the cookies!
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure seemed to incarcerate her mind, preventing her from taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to incarcerate the sun, casting a shadow over the town.

meanings.sent1: The zookeepers had to incarcerate the escaped monkey before it caused any trouble.
meanings.sent2: During the riot, the police had to quickly incarcerate the violent protestors.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally incarcerate my keys in the car, and now I can't get in!
meanings.sent4: His guilt seemed to incarcerate him in a cycle of self-doubt and regret.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell appeared to incarcerate the audience in a state of wonder and awe.
